greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of labeled simple connected graphs with n vertices and exactly one bridge.
comment: A bridge is an edge that, if removed without removing any incident vertices, disconnects the graph. Connected graphs with no bridges are counted by A095983 (2-edge-connected graphs).
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..50
Gus Wiseman, The a(4) = 12 graphs with exactly one bridge.
program: seq(n)={my(p=x*deriv(log(sum(k=0, n-1, 2^binomial(k, 2) * x^k / k!) + O(x^n)))); Vec(serlaplace(log(x/serreverse(x*exp(p)))^2/2), -(n+1)) } \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, Dec 28 2020
xref: Connected graphs with no bridges are A007146.
Connected graphs whose bridges are all leaves are A322395.
Connected graphs with at least one bridge are A327071.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Aug 24 2019
ext: Terms a(6) and beyond from _Andrew Howroyd_, Aug 25 2019
